snippet: The fears of public officials and humanitarian groups were realized on Monday, when thousands of asylum seekers backed up at border crossings.
abstract: Migrants stalled at tightened border crossings are caught in cold and rain, as Europe continues to disagree over how to handle influx; period of relative calm has been disrupted by Hungary closing its border with Croatia and Austria, slowing acceptance of migrants; increasing tension feeds diplomatic quarreling and anti-refugee sentiment.

byline.contributor: Matthew Brunwasser contributed reporting from Berkasovo, Serbia; Joseph Orovic from Zadar, Croatia; and Alison Smale from Dresden, Germany.

lead_paragraph: The fears of public officials and humanitarian groups were realized on Monday, when thousands of asylum seekers backed up at border crossings.

headline.main: Stranded in Cold Rain, a Logjam of Migrants in the Balkans
headline.print_headline: A Logjam of Migrants, Growing in a Cold Rain

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
